author: Sven Sundgaard
title: Even colder Thursday night into the weekend
text:
Even colder Thursday night into the weekend
Minnesota will miss a big snow to the south
Go Deeper.
Create an account or log in to save stories.
Like this?
Thanks for liking this story! We have added it to a list of your favorite stories.
Temperatures Thursday night will drop to the single digits with subzero north. We should see partly cloudy skies Friday with temperatures running about 10 degrees below normal.
Colder-than-normal temps persist through the weekend into next week
It’ll be colder Thursday night with more breaks in the clouds and even colder air sliding through the region. Overnight lows will be in the single digits south to single digits below zero north. Wind chill values will be below zero statewide.
Friday will be even chillier with highs not reaching 20 degrees even in southern Minnesota. We’ll see highs mid-teens to just near zero northwest with partly cloudy skies.
The weekend will see very similar temperatures with highs mostly in the teens south and near zero north. Saturday will be brighter with clouds increasing Sunday.
Turn Up Your Support
MPR News helps you turn down the noise and build shared understanding. Turn up your support for this public resource and keep trusted journalism accessible to all.
A storm system Sunday will stay mostly south of Minnesota thanks to our colder-than-normal pattern, which will persist into next week.
Snow lovers are really having a tough winter again. Snow depth ranks in the bottom 1 to 5 percent across most of the state.
To date, seasonal snowfall deficits range from 7 inches below normal in St. Cloud to as much as 22 inches below normal in Duluth. The Twin Cities is 11 inches behind.
Snow depth is just 3 inches in Duluth where average snow depth for early January should be 11 inches.
A clipper system next Thursday may be the only hope for any measurable snowfall in the future.

author: TOI Tech Desk
title: Former Google employee who lead company’s AI projects is now on Amazon’s board of directors - Times of India
text: Amazon has announced that it has appointed Dr. Andrew Ng to its Board of Directors, effective April 9, 2024. A prominent figure in artificial intelligence (AI), he is currently serving as the managing general partner of AI Fund, a venture capital firm focused on AI startups. Ng also also leads DeepLearning.AI, an educational platform for AI training, and co-founded Landing AI, a computer vision software company. Additionally, Ng co-founded and chaired Coursera, a massive open online course provider where he served as co-CEO until 2014. He currently holds an adjunct professorship at Stanford University.Dr. Andrew Ng worked at Google, BaiduNg has also worked in some of the world’s biggest tech companies in the US and China. He served as chief scientist and vice president at Baidu from 2014 to 2017. The company is dubbed as ‘Google of China’. Ng has also led Google's Brain (Deep Learning) project from 2011 to 2012.“We seek to have appropriate experience and perspectives at all levels of the company, including our Board of Directors, and we’re excited to welcome Dr. Ng,” the company said in a blog post.Amazon highlights Ng's expertise in both AI and education, particularly generative AI, a rapidly evolving field. His experience developing machine learning and deep learning technologies, coupled with his involvement in companies building and adopting AI applications, is expected to provide valuable insights for the Board regarding the opportunities and challenges presented by AI.Ng's appointment comes at a time when the companies are shifting gears to invest more in the development of AI, especially generative artificial intelligence (GenAI). Microsoft recently hired Mustafa Suleyman to lead its AI unit and opened an office in London, Google also merged its two teams: Google Brain and DeepMind to form Google DeepMind to take command of its AI projects.

author: Charles Watson, WPVI via CNN Newsource
title: ‘She saved my son’s life’: Taco Bell manager saves baby who stopped breathing in drive-thru
text:
RICHBORO, Pa. (WPVI) - A family in Pennsylvania says they have a quick-thinking Taco Bell manager to thank for saving their child’s life.
Natasha Long says the situation started when her 11-week-old baby suddenly stopped breathing while she was in the drive-thru at the fast-food restaurant.
“It was the scariest moment of my entire life,” Long said.
The mother of two had just finished some errands and decided to grab food when she says she noticed baby Myles struggling for air in the back seat of the car.
“I pulled him out and he turned completely blue and was lifeless. At that point I just completely blacked out. I didn’t know what to do,” she said.
Fortunately, Long was in earshot of Taco Bell manager Becky Arbaugh, who heard the mother’s screams and quickly jumped in to give baby Myles CPR.
“I ran outside and took the baby,” Arbaugh said. “I then started to do chest compressions on the baby, and he finally started to breathe.”
Long said the manager appeared out of nowhere like a guardian angel.
According to Arbaugh, her own scares as a mother helped her prepare for a moment like this.
“When my kids were little, my daughter had similar incidents. So, I knew what she was feeling, and there was no thought in my mind that the baby wasn’t going to breathe again,” Arbaugh said.
Baby Myles did regain his breath and was rushed to Saint Christopher’s Hospital for treatment.
The next day Long said she called Taco Bell to thank Arbaugh, who she calls her hero.
“We couldn’t be more grateful to Becky. She saved my son’s life,” Long said.
Baby Myles remains in the hospital as doctors try to understand what happened to him.
Meanwhile, Long has been sending videos and pictures to Arbaugh -- who now has a deep bond with the family.
Copyright 2024 WPVI via CNN Newsource. All rights reserved.

author: Mover Tracker
title: Amedisys Shares Soar 3.21% on Strong Q1 Earnings
text:
Amedisys Shares Soar 3.21% on Strong Q1 Earnings
Amedisys (AMED) shares surged 3.21% intraday, reaching their highest level since November 2024, marking a third consecutive day of gains with a total increase of 2.04% over the past three days.
Amedisys reported its financial results for the first quarter of 2025, posting a profit of $61 million and earnings per share (EPS) of $1.84. This performance indicates a profitable quarter, with earnings increasing compared to the same period last year and surpassing Wall Street estimates.
Despite the strong EPS performance, the company's revenue of $594.8 million slightly missed estimates, presenting a mixed financial outcome for the period. This discrepancy between earnings and revenue may have contributed to the stock's recent volatility.
On April 17, 2025, [amedisys] extended its credit facility amid merger discussions. This move could impact the company's financial flexibility and strategic opportunities, potentially influencing investor sentiment and stock price movements.
topics: Economy, Business and Finance->business reporting and performance
